bricks-owner-name.description: kSpeedrunning's generated bricks owner name (requires server restart to apply)

zone-start-color.description: Color of start zone bricks (rgb, max 255)

zone-checkpoint-color.description: Color of checkpoint zone bricks (rgb, max 255)

zone-end-color.description: Color of end zone bricks (rgb, max 255)

zone-brick-material.description: Material and intensity of zone bricks. First number is material (0-glass, 1-glow, 2-hologram). Second number is intensity (1-10)

zone-brick-thiccness.description: Thickness of zone bricks (1 = 2x, 2 = 4x, etc.. max 5)

force-checkpoint-sequence.description: Force passing checkpoints in order. ex. having to pass (1,2,3,4,end) or being able to go (1,4,2,3,end). Could lessen CPU usage slightly. Also requires manual checkpoint ordering

checkpoint-size-consideration.description: Lets the position checking consider the zone size for more accurate checking. Can Largely increase CPU usage near checkpoints (may even time out plugin)

color-whitelist.description: Color pallete indexes that the plugin will use to find zone bricks. Only use if you use zone pieces as map detail, otherwise leave empty to disable. Learn !speedrun:paintindex command to use this

authorized-users.description: For use of restricted commands (some commands require debug and auth)

enable-debug.description: Enables debug commands (all debug commands require auth)

commands.name: /start
commands.description: Run in a start zone to start your run

commands.name: /stop
commands.description: Run while in a run to end and return to it's start zone

commands.name: /speedrun
commands.description: A parent command, containing lots of functionality commands inside

args.name: command
args.description: The command you want to run

args.name: sub-command
args.description: The sub-command you want to run

args.name: value
args.description: The value used by certain commands/sub-commands
